rComments: I have taken Boogaart courses every year since my first year. Now I am in my final semester for my BA in History and Political Science. Boogaart is one of the best history professors I have met. Do his readings, pay attention to his lectures and you will do well. He is very caring and will help you all the way.

As a non-history student and as a first-year I found Boogaarts style overwhelming. I was committing at least 4 hours to watch lectures outside of the lecture time (+readings and other work). Not engaging. Was condescending outside of class time and clearly has been using the same material for years, seems bored w/ it.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The professor is very disorganized. His assignments and requirements are so numerous that even he cannot keep track of them. He contradicts himself in his lectures which makes studying for exams difficult. For a history professor he has a surprising lack of knowledge or interest in Canadian History.

I like how interested he is in history and that's definitely motivating but I felt like his tests were super hard even though they were multiple choice and i was not a huge fan of the many many lecture videos outside of the actual scheduled lectures (lots of info)

The class itself was super interesting! I genuinely enjoyed watching the lectures, he always had lots of cool info to share, he's very knowledgeable and passionate about teaching the subject. But the class had a lot of work that you couldn't not do (frequent quizzes and assignments). You def have an advantage if you know your stuff already.

His lectures are very well done and you WILL learn. Weekly quizzes are extremely hard and assignments are hit and miss. This class took so much time and effort: This class will dominant your semester.

He was a good professor. I really liked how he was very specific on what he wanted for essays and test preparations. He wrote the textbook for the course and if you do not read it, you will fail tests, quizzes and the exam was mostly all info from the textbook.

Not a beginner friendly class. If your knowledgeable in global history you'll be fine even so get ready to work. Unit tests every 2 weeks but you have about 12 hours (if you read fast) of prep between unit test and thats if you want a B average. Tests are very detail oriented but it is open book. Very nice and understanding professor though.
teacherRatingTags: ['Test heavy', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Avoid at all cost. There were assignments and tests due every two weeks and SO much reading. I had lots of friends in this class (at least 5) and they all made the wise decision to drop it. The class was asynchronous so we depended on the textbook to learn everything. Only take this class if youre already very knowledgeable in history.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework', 'So many papers']

rComments: The content is interesting, but not worth learning if it costs you your grade. Quizzes are unnecessarily hard that no matter how many notes I kept I couldn't do better than a C. Instructions are confusing, assignments hard to achieve (and so many things to submit), and not easy to talk to out of class.

Boogaart is a cool guy, but this class was unnecessarily hard. Pre-recorded lectures are tough to follow, and I'm surprised he only offered 100% asynchronous or an advanced project. Like, both options sound bad? The weekly quizzes were impossible. Easily the hardest class I've taken. Only enroll if it's in person or live.

His class is interesting but I feel the assignments he gives out are vague, and the tests unnecessarily difficult (ie multiple choice involving very specific details regarding a 30-page reading we did)
Sadly, my least favourite professor. His course was unnecessarily difficult and I did not enjoy myself. The content was interesting but long, and his tests sucked. Don't recommend.

Not only did he put out lose to six hours a week of lectures, his quiz and test questions were almost incomprehensible and even keeping notes from all lectures and readings had me bombing every quiz. Lectures were interesting but didn't make up for the rest of it. Don't recommend.

This is my second class of his, and I feel as though these classes have changed my entire world perspective. It is a lot of work, but honestly his classes are the only type that are worth the amount of work. You HAVE to read the textbook, but it follows how he lectures. He also moves through a lot of material quickly so you should attend class.

I would definitely take his class again! He made the class super interesting and it was one of my morning classes so each morning, depending on the region we were talking about, he would blast a song related to the topic! really woke me up LOL

One of the best profs I've ever had. This was a hybrid class so it was great to have time to do modules on Brightspace when you wanted and then one in-person class a week. There were quizzes ever 2 weeks (MC), 3 papers, and 1 Final Exam (MC and short answer). Take good notes and put the effort in and receive a great mark.
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Get ready to read', 'Accessible outside class']

rComments: Excellent teacher. Make the class intriguing and is very helpful. However he can be a tough grader at time and you have to be ready to do one test every 2 weeks

Professor Boogaart is nice and very clear. The tests were extremely fair and based on what we learned in class or in the readings. However, I did find that the marking for assignments was extremely harsh. The prof gave plenty of opportunities for bonus points though. Overall, they're a solid prof but the assignments are tough.

I do not recommend taking his class as an elective.. he gives a lot of work and expects a lot.. hard to manage if you have 5 classes in a semester. I was told it would be a great bird course but it really was not.

This man is a total gem. Makes the class very interesting, holds review sessions before every test and gives out bonus points in fun ways such as hosting online games of Diplomacy . While there is a lot of work in the course, the prof makes it tolerable and interesting. If more profs were like this man Uottawa would defs be a better place

Hands down one of my favourite profs. The course is rigourous because a lot happened in the last 80 years of World History. He is a beautifully articulate, witty and inspirational speaker. Each of his classes have quick videos and discussions, I like this because it diversifies the learning so it's not just listening & note taking.
(online, covid year) Way to much work, even for a third-year course. Don't take this guy if your trying to balance school with other commitments.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Graded by few things', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: Boogaart is passionate about what he teaches and works very hard to deliver the class material in the most interesting and captivating way possible. However, he expects a lot from his students so prepare to work hard. Best professor at Uottawa I'va had so far.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: class average was 40%. speaks in a very confusing manner (uses random big words). focuses on minute historical details. brushes over important historical events. ID questions are marked wayy too hard. MC q's are very annoying. textbook is by him, so it is not very helpful (just google stuff if you're confused). paper was pretty easy.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He cares about his students' success. He gives very detailed instructions for exams and assignments. The only professor that gave mini-lectures about the basics of how to write a university-level paper!!! The subject is not too difficult and with a lot of bonus and participation, it is very easy to get B or higher with moderate effort

Boogaart's course was my hardest this semester. The individual lectures are too dense, and not enough time is spent to understand important events. It is very difficult to keep up, and his exams are very tough. The average grade for my final exam was a D+. It was a two-hour exam worth 40% of our mark. If given the option, I would avoid him.

He uses slides and puts them up during class but the content is more for him as like key points so if you want decent notes, just copy down what he says in class or read the textbook (that he wrote and is written how he speaks which is very confusing and hard to understand.) Hard marker. Exam was the hardest, and poorly reflected the review sheet.

As much as I love history the way this prof teaches is by summarizing important keypoints in ONE CLASS, and by the next week, the subject has changed completely so if you miss even one class youll no doubt lag behind. Talks a lot, gives powerpoint presentation but I feel like theyre always too broad to be important. Hardest history class Ive took

I'm currently taking HIS1111 as an online course and the workload is ridiculous. There are at least three assignments due each week and the amount of content to go through is overwhelming. There are several videos and articles you have to read through if you even want to pass the quizzes/tests. Do not take this course if you can avoid it.

I'm taking this class online. It's a slew of mostly primary sources that take hours to sift through, little direction, then 4+ evaluations per week on material that may or may not even be in that material. Add in grammatical incoherence, technical problems, and factually incorrect info, and this is the worst class I've taken in all 4 years.

I took this online class. There is so much reading and work you must put in each week for a first year intro course it's borderline ridiculous. And after all that work you are graded on multiple choice questions with tricky answer choices, making you lose marks because you answered "A and C only" and not "all of the above"

He kept putting in eye drops throughout lectures, including while talking to students, very distracting and also just weird. As well, he is unbalanced with grading schemes, and his instructions for assignments and exams are incredibly vague and impossible to follow/understand.

I mean he's sort of, maybe, o.k, but if you have the choice between him and any other history teacher, don't pick him. You should have no trouble passing his class, but getting an A would be almost impossible. Really boring to listen to during lectures.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Hands-down my favourite professor! I wont lie, his courses are tough (reading heavy and lectures are critical) bc he pushes you to think critically about the world around you and how you are involved in/with it. I can honestly say that after 3 courses with him(so far) time spent in his class has made me a better historian and a better human.

Really liked him! He was very engaging, extremely clear on the essay we had to write. Exam is just like the midterm (which was pretty easy). Im definitely gonna take him again for some more history and im not even studying history haha

Unrealistic workload for an online course. The time spent going over the content definitely would exceed the two and a half hours per week of class, as well as time spent to actually do well in this course. For a first year history course, it would turn a lot of people away from history. Definitely take the in class version, instead.

Professor Boogaart was one of my favourite professors, he cares about your input and makes the classes super interactive. I thought I would dread the subject he taught but ended up really enjoying it because of his lectures. I will definitely take his courses again.
Fantastic Professor! Gives tons of feedback, cares about students, grades fairly. He is clearly passionate about students and teaching and that is reflected in his courses. Highly recommend!
He was a decent lecturer, but gives annoying assignments.

Overall I really liked this class! Boogaart is an eccentric guy who makes lectures really interesting. The midterm and essay were easy, but the exam was hard. He loves when people ask short intelligent questions, but if you ramble he will cut you off.
sooooo good

Personally, I dont understand how anyone could have a problem with this prof. He is an outstanding teacher and could not be more clear in his expectations. He is extremely engaging and passionate about what he teaches. His classes are not the easiest, but if you do the readings and actually go to class youll do well. I highly recommend this prof

Really passionate during his lectures, and he's always looking for ways to improve his teaching methods to help students succeed as much as possible. His workshops for essays are also useful and he gives you advice and he's always ready to meet with you to put you on the right track for your papers.
Great Proff! Really wholesome and fun lectures!
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Graded by few things']

rComments: He's not a terrible prof, but I wasn't a fan of his lecture style.  Especially because for the most part, he would mention a very important event in history and then not even explain what it was, leaving the students to look it up ourselves.  The assignments weren't necessarily difficult, just annoying.  He's passionate about history, at least.

I took this class as a history elective, and it was awesome. There is a bit of a workload, but if you actually put in effort, you'll be fine. He's kind of an oddball (typical historian) but he is caring, and fair on all assignments and exams. Also, if you miss a lecture, you can just google the content as it is all world history. Give him a shot!

This prof makes this class so much more difficult than it has to be. He makes his syllabus so convoluted because there are so many assignments and doesn't explain what he wants out of them until you get them back with a bad mark. He is passive aggressive, inconsistent, very subjective, and often states blatantly incorrect information in lectures.
Difficult to schedule an appointment outside of class.

Best out of faculty course taken. History is not my major, but I really enjoy history. It requires some degree of work and commitment, but it equips you with basic research and analytic tools for historians. Great professor with lot of work and dedication on the course. If you are in, you will enjoy it.

Boogaart makes history interesting, easy to follow, and hilarious at times- pay attention and take notes during his classes and you should do fine, he's extremely approachable for after-class questions too

He is kind of a weird guy, but lectures are easy to follow and workload is pretty easy. Watch out for the exam and midterm, there are some trick questions that he throws in. He is really into class participation and discussion.

I'm strangely going to miss all his polls and comments. This prof is really nice and does care for his students, even tries to learn all their names. Yes the workload is heavier than normal classes, but it's not a difficult workload at all, they all help you understand the material well. I really like this prof, and yes you have to go to lectures.

I really like this professor. I'm taking HIS1111 with him and I'm actually surprisingly enjoying myself. The online class is pretty heavy in terms of work but the assignments help you understand the content more thoroughly. I feel like he does teach in a way where students are kind of expected to have some historical knowledge which can be tough
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Participation matters', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: He absolutely loves history and he is very passionate about it which makes the lectures extremely interesting. The lectures are absolutely important to passing, so make sure you show up and take notes. Extremely nice and open to helping you if you have any questions whether in class or after hours.

He was prof to two of my history classes last year, and was tolerable. Try and avoid 3 hour classes with him as they become dry and tedious. He has clear expectations, is very understanding, and is willing to give extra help if you approach him.

In my opinion, this prof is absolutely useless. He teaches like all his students are history majors and would know exactly what he's talking about even if some of us don't have a history background. His powerpoints are a lot of point form dates and he hardly goes into lots of detail of historical events. Avoid this class+prof, especially in summer
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Really nice guy, okay professor. If you pay attention during the lectures and keep up with the readings, you'll be fine.

Honestly the worst prof I've had yet. He is passive-aggressive and just not understanding at all. Very unhelpful in terms of responses to emails and input on assignments. His guidelines are very unclear. This course's objective is to teach you proper essay writing techniques and I came out of it learning nothing. Avoid like the plague!
teacherRatingTags: ['Lecture heavy', 'Get ready to read', 'Lots of homework']

rComments: He was easily the worst prof I have had yet here in the history department. His HIS2100 class is filled with stupid assignments that would not belong in high school let alone university (get ready to write a fake CV for a fake job).  He is extremely vague when marking and tries to cram way too much in power points. He also loves his eye drops.

I'm really not fond of this dude. His lectures are sprawling and confusing, and he's overly fond of using flowery language that honestly has no place in a writing class. Makes grand, romantic assumptions. Strikes me as kind of an idiot. Assignments are short, but numerous and painful. Instructions are not clear, and his feedback is useless. Avoid.

Wasn't my favourite prof but wasn't the worst. His lectures got dull at times but if you're really into history it probably isn't. If you go to class and listen most of the time, you should do well with a little extra research for assignments. Tests were easy, assignments were easy. Overall a pretty good course.

Tbh I didn't try nearly as hard as I should've and I still did well. You need to attend class to understand the material (though if you HAVE to skip, google is your friend when deciphering his slides). He's a great prof, and makes his lectures interesting, I would definitely take one of his classes again.

Overall, he was an alright prof. There is no doubt that he is extremely knowledgeable in his field, and his lectures are usually engaging. However he definitely tries to pack way too much into his slideshows... by the end he's skipping info to pack all his slides into one lecture. If you don't attend class, good luck trying to decipher his slides.

This is the second class that I've had with this professor. He is very helpful and open to any questions that you may have. His lectures are interesting and very informative. I recommend attending classes for a better grade.

I wasn't a fan at all of the discussion and journal assignments, and found he tried to pack too much into his lectures. There was also a bit too much hand holding, to the point where I felt like I was in high school again. The midterm and final are reasonable and its's definitely possible to get a good grade in the course with some effort.

Fantastic Prof! He really made me love my history class in the evenings, despite long days at the office. Very humorous and covered global forces such as WWII, the Cold War, Decolonization, Globalization all in different regions using a comparative historical approach. The TA however, should attend because of inconsistencies with marking & lectures
Great Professor, keeps the class engaged so you might have a hard time trying to fall asleep. Attending lectures are important unless you want to read the entire 700pg textbook.

Very nice person, clear lectures, made it interesting. However, the marking on the assignments was very odd indeed. That was more the TA.  He also seemed to ask for student feedback waaay too much, and sent out reminders about assignments being due. I can see that he was trying to be helpful, but the hand-wringing and hand-holding was unnecessary.

A real nice guy. He's there for his students and wants to make the best learning experience for them. Very interesting lectures with a lot of images and videos to deepen your knowledge. Only 2 exams, 2 texts assignments  of 400 words each and 3 online group discussions.
All multiple choice midterm and final.
Great Prof, really cares about the students. Made me love my history class.
Prof Boogaart is a competent prof, although his teaching methods could be improved, his introductory course does a good enough job to prepare history students for whats to come

Midterms and exams are fine - the essays are not. Essay marking is senseless, it looks like the TAs take marks off because they don't agree with the way you wrote something, even if what you did is technically right. Most "corrections" are arguable, some even questionable. Lectures boring, prof uses puffed up language, goes on rants about ecology

Essays were kind of confusing, finals and midterms are not difficult if you study the review questions and terms he gives you. Nice guy and encouraging to talk to, but sort of superfluous and hard to understand in lectures. Not very clear or chronological and tends to deviate from history, but gives more than enough reading material to succeed.

Slides and course material contain errors. Left out the due date for the second option on final ass. in the syllabus. Acts as though he knows about the wilderness and makes unfounded statements. Exams are difficult and assignments are marked by a TA who doesn't even read the instructions. Clearly no communication with the prof. Not recommended.

Super nice guy. Although, his exams are rather difficult, the essays were easy and had interesting topics to choose from. He is amazingly helpful and gives you every possibility and opportunity to get a good grade in his class: this includes giving you extra credit work if you need it. Also a great guy to talk to!

Horrible prof! Hard to understand, unhelpful, messy and unorganized lectures, expects you to have his level of knowledge- doesn't teach, only analyzes in depth and expects you to know EVERY detail about the subject before he teaches it (not in textbook either, which is also not helpful!). I'm a history major, love the subject, dropped the class :(
There honestly couldn't be a worse prof, unavailable, hard to understand and impossible to please. Avoid at all costs if you want to have an enjoyable experience or a decent mark

the exam is extremely hard, he give 5 long and confused mc choices and he is a hard marker. his slides are too much and he is really unhelpful to organize them. Also, the time of exam is really limited. FINAL JUST HAVE TWO Hours WITH A HUGE NUMBERS OF Questions

Prof. Boogaart was a very knowledgeable teacher. He seemed very invested in what he was teaching, but needs to cut down and summarize his lectures. It would be helpful if things were put in simpler terms.Otherwise, a great teacher and interesting class material!

Having taken multiple classes of his, I can say that they aren't super easy but hes very helpful and knowledgeable about history. His class is boring but we all learned so much. He gives you everything for midterms and exams and they're mostly all multiple choice with 4 identify questions. Great prof.

Prof. Boogaart is absolutely the worst professor at UOttawa! He completely turned me off history. He is very unprofessional: his slides contain numerous grammatical errors, his lectures are disorganized and extremely dull, he makes inappropriate remarks, and he makes ZERO effort to help students outside class. Avoid this prof like the plague!
Really nice guy, but can't teach to save his life. His elaboration on lecture slides has nothing to do with the lecture itself. Assignments are random and irrelevant.

Terrible prof, content for the course isnt relevant to anything at all, the projects were made just as busy works, no correlation to anything what so ever. His lectures are extremely boring, and makes you feel as a history class. The exam WAS NOT RELEVENT TO THE COURSE OR THE LECTURES. Each page had 3 mc which was all paragraphs long. Don't take.
He uses the word 'indian' not first nation/aboriginal person or even native. Innapropriate for a university class
Too much information to absorb from slides. MC extremely tricky. Not very available outside of class.
I liked this Prof! He knows his stuff and his exams aren't too hard. He always answers emails and is very nice. I suggest you take his class, even if it isn't the most exciting.

My favourite first year prof. Boogaart gives interesting lectures and is extremely knowledgeable. He prepares a study guide for his exams that tell you EXACTLY what he wants. Very reasonable essay questions. Very active on VC boards. You will not get an easy A in this class, if you work hard it is very possible and very rewarding to do well.
TOMMY IS BEST

Lecturer that is too heavy on slides. Too much information such that you are unable to absorb the information. Gives too much readings. Final was too much to write in a 2-hour period. Overall a mediocre professor.
He was an excellent professor and I enjoyed his class very much. I learned a lot from his class and would strongly recommend it.

The prof is great, first time ever I've found history interesting. It's true that the exams are tough, and my average has certainly gone down because of it, but if you just spend some extra time outside of class you should do well.

Great prof! Really interesting, used popular music videos as an intro to his lectures. His assignments are easy and well laid out, with lots of help given. He expands on the info on the slides and videos. Don't bother getting the textbook if your going to class. He is always available to help and puts EVERYTHING on virtual campus. Take his class!

Expectations are way too high. This class will bring your average down. I'm in my 4th year of history and this prof's expectations are higher than most i've seen, at any level. Seems like a nice guy who does care about teaching, but I would avoid if you don't want to invest a lot of time for a bad grade.
It's impossible to get a mark above 70 in his class. Go ahead and jump in if you want to lower your average but stay away if you know what's good for you

This prof is the BEST. You'll need to study and go to class, but you can guarantee that you'll enjoy the way he lectures and his sense of humor. Defiantly take a class with this guy! I had 3 with him in my fist year and i'm dying for another! take his courses!
If you think his tests are impossible you should not be attending University.

Fantastic prof. I am in my third year and he still stands out in my mind as a great teacher. He is clearly passionate about teaching, and conveys the subject matter very well. You need to work in this class, but if you do you will be well rewarded. Take his history class.

Overall, he tries really hard at what he does and seems well read. The ppts and notes are quite helpful but essays can come across vague because the topics are unconventional. However, I believe he puts in lots of effort and tries hard enough to make it interesting. 3 hour lecs are not his thing though, better for 1h30 classes.

Dive right in if you feel like lowering your average. You CANNOT get an A in his class. You can either be a savant and get an A+, or a normal person and get a B. His multiple choice questions are impossible, and his written assignments are cryptic and vague.

I really liked this prof.  To be fair, he has been the only History prof I've had thus far, but so far the experience has been excellent, and has made me decide to change my degree to a double major (Poli-Sci and now History).  I'm still impressed by how he was able to touch on so many subjects in depth while still staying on schedule.

Interesting prof! He knows what he's talking about and I definitely learned a lot from him. You MUST attend lectures and take notes. There's a lot of reading. Don't expect an easy A, but expect to work hard and come out of this class less ignorant. He's very helpful when responding to emails, unless you ask something he's already answered.

I took HIS1111 before 1110. Bad experience at first. I found his mult.choice exams tough b/c of multiple right answers. Bad grade. BUT, in 1110, I aced his class. Just study the key terms on the review sheet and all goes well. He is not attention grabbing but not boring either. Assignments are a good wake up call for first year students.

A well meaning person who really knows his stuff and you can tell. But I found his lectures very unclear and hard to follow. It seemed a lot of material on the exam was covered directly in the lectures. The many materials he used were interesting but kind of confusing. It's not him that's the problem but how he presented the material...
He is a Calvinist and lets you know about it. He knows his**** and if you are interested in history he is good. He gives-er

Don't expect this class to be an easy A, but the content of the course was extremely interesting. Boogaart really gives you a vast variety of knowledge that connects the dots together. There's a lot of material to read, and the assignments are a little weird/hard, but GO TO HIS LECTURES. Don't skip them. Even if you're just there dozing off!

OMG WORST CLASS OF MY LIFE. He was extremely rude when a student would email him with Questions. His MC were SOO Hard. One question would have 5 possible Answers and VERY LONG. Do NOT take this class. Hes so boring and Dull. I studied for 5 days straight and got a D+. Bring your avg down for nothing. Do NOT take this class!!!
Puts all content on virtual campus, good at mixing lectures with videos.
such a helpful guy! so sweet and goes out of his way for students. Exams are a bit tedious, even though they are mc, because questions and options are very long.

Interesting guy. Assignments were very straight forward. Both midterm and final were entirely multiple choice. Only issue was he tried to cram a lot in his 3 hour lecture so it was hard to catch a lot of specifics. Always posted his slides on virtual campus so it was really easy to study. Overall a good prof.
Excellent first year course and prof. Very knowledgeable and humourous. Engaging lectures and interesting year-end paper topics. Loved it.
Do NOT take his classes. He does not explain the material we are supposed to be talking about and his notes are really unhelpful!

He is definitely a strange guy.  Unfortunately I found the schedule to be unbalanced and focused on what seemed to be his own interests.  He's also very unhelpful on the Virtual Campus website.  However, he is a very good lecturer and his classes are almost always interesting.  His slides are informative and easy to study from.
He was fantastic in terms of both his teaching style and way of interpreting history.

Great Prof, if you do the readings and go to class you will be fine! He is really passionate about history. I had no interest in history before, and now his class is one of my favourites! Multiple choice was a little tough, but not impossible. Keep it up!
He's extremely confusing, boring and WAAAAY too much reading, switch out of his class right now.  Seriously.  I just saved your life.
Awesome prof.  Very interesting and knows his material.  Classes are very interactive and promote a great learning environment.  Lots of reading to be done (which i didn't do) but managed to get a B.
For the love of God avoid his classes!

Professor Boogaart is a nice guy, who is willing to help his students. However his syllabus is the extremely confusing, and might be the hardest part of the course. Pretty interesting man, not a big fan of class participation however.

I read reviews before and they are true, some classes have 2 sets of powerpoint slides and lecture notes PLUS readings from the reader.  WAY too much for a freshman class.  Plus gives conflicting due dates for assignments and gets annoyed when students complain?  Having a 15 page document (besides the sylabus) on how to take course is rediculous.

THe amount of reading for this course is absolutely rediculous especially when you consider most of the people in it are there for a classics credit, not because they want to make Western Europe in the middle Ages their life's work. His grading is terrible, I'll avoid him and history in general for the rest ofmy academic career... Awful jackass.

Oh my GOD! He was impossible. Powerpoint notes but you HAVE to be there to hear him talk because otherwise you'll see "Levittown" written but will have no idea what it is. Midterms? Not too bad. Journal assignments? Don't even expect to get a good mark. Exam?? IMPOSSIBLE! Multiple choice was horrid! Nice man, great historical content but too hard!!

This course had A LOT of reading required. To get a good mark you actually have to do the readings which are sometimes REALLY boring. He was a good lecturer and understood that it's hard for first years to adjust to the university experience.  However, the marking in that class was ridiculously hard!

OVER COMPLICATES EVERTHING, wrote a 9 page tutorial on how to approach the exam question which made it a million times more confusing. I love history, the material is fascinating, but this is the WORST COURSE EVER because of how he structures it. Map identification on the midterm/final that have nothing to with places we learn about in class.

Prof was ver well-versed in the subject, presented well, and gave the students more than enough material to pass with flying colours... but it was an entry-level elective for most, and most weren't very interested... I guess it was a little geeky to many students. I thought he was great, but the students have to apply themselves. Not coastable.

I was a little bit torn about the class. I thought the assighments were interesting, allowing to put our own spin on the subject. However, the lectures left a little bit to be desired, not at all interactive, and the same thing every day. LESS POWERPOINT PLEASE!
he's such a hard grader. And there are way too many readings in this class. his midterm and his final exam are VERY HARD!!!
An alright professor, I enjoyed the movie clips we got to watch. But there was a lot of reading material and the midterm & exam were pretty tough!

He wasnt the most interesting speaker in the world, but he wasnt that bad. His assignments are really easy as long as you do them, same with marking on research paper. Midterm and exam were tough, and required a good amount of textbook work. A good mark is possible if willing to do moderate work for it.

This was a TOUGH class. The amount of readings to be done was a little overwhelming, but he warns you on the first day that it will be like that. The immersion assignment was interesting and a nice break from the traditional essay. I would recommend him just to see a different teaching style. Be aware that it is mainly independent learning!

The material is interesting but the assignments are stupid. Felt like a high school assignment. Professor seems "holier-than-thou" but is still kinda nice. I finished with an A but I wouldn't take it again.

This wasnt a history course,it was a mix of philosophy and current events.The immersion assignment is impossible for students to write,and equally impossible for the PROF to mark.Assumptions students were instructed to avoid were used in the evaluation process.The Prof believed he knew it all, no selection by a student could be beyond his learning.

I really enjoy listening to him lecture and he makes it easy enough to stay interested, however his tests are extremely thorough and you need to do all of the work. He marks very hard and follows all university policies by the book. The Immersion assignment requires a lot of work and effort considering it is only worth 10%.
Worst teacher...

Awful class! I was so excited about taking this class but I got there on the first day and I knew I had made a big mistake in taking the class. The prof is awful, the material is boring, the projects/papers have no purpose, and it's all Boogaart's fault!!! DROP THIS CLASS NOW!!! IT'S NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY!
Disliked the way the class was run overall.
Horrible Professor.

HIS2335 was one of the most interesting classes I ever took, thanks to the prof.He made the students mingle so that we knew one another and work in groups. He made us write about ourselevs as a medieval characer, he made us play a simulation of the Moorlemaye.i will take another of his class anytime.

Run to the Registars office and Drop this Class Immediately!  It doesn't get better, it's like walking back into high school.  I have learnt NOTHING and it was such a waste of time.  The Immersion Assignment makes no sense and is so un-productive....BRUTAL
DROP THIS CLASS RIGHT NOW. The worst class ever, you'll learn nothing and your only source is a book for a 12 year old. Waste of time. And the immersion assignment...just don't take the class.

I thought he was a nice guy, but the medieval game of life was unbearable.  He does make the material interesting, but fails to teach a lot of the material that appears on the exam. However, i feel bad saying anything negative because he is SUCH a nice man.

he is a nice man and really wants to make history fun. but his simulation game is torture and so confusing. you learn nothing and it is impossible to pass the exam because he teaches NOTHING in class but expects you to know everything about the dark ages on your own.

This is the WORST prof I have ever had. I was a 4th year history major when I took this class and I hated everything about it. I felt like I was in kindergarden everytime I stepped in the room the simulation was STUPID. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS!! He is unclear and you feel like you have learned nothing when the class is over...what a WASTE OF TIME!!

He makes no sense

WORST PROF EVER! The "simulation" (i.e. play dress-up) will give you nightmares, and it takes over the class. He will give you a list of important terms then refuse to define them. He 'forgot' to cover the Crusades (!). Oh, and his midterms are impossibly hard. Enjoy!

My Expectations were really high before I step into this class. If the word simulation scares me now as well, the Town of Bruges is now out of my travel list. I think it was his first class on this medieval topic. Improvement is definetely required, otherwise you will loose your time.

All I can say is that the next time I hear the word "Simulation," I may just start twitching. *twitch* Unclear in what he wants, he lets you torture yourself over every assignment. And don't get me started on his TA :o
